title: Calories in a Ham and Cheese Croissant
meta_description: Discover calories in ham cheese croissant, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Ham and Cheese Croissant
assumptions: Standard bakery-style ham and cheese croissant (~100 g), with sliced ham, cheddar cheese, baked with buttery pastry; no extra condiments.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, portion size, cheese type, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A ham and cheese croissant provides ~350 kcal, with good protein from the ham and cheese.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat cheese and lean ham

faqs.q: How many calories in ham cheese croissant?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for one standard serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a ham and cheese croissant?
faqs.a: About 12 g protein, mainly from the ham and cheese.

faqs.q: Are ham cheese croissants high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 18 g total fat, including 9 g saturated from the pastry and cheese.

faqs.q: How much sodium in a ham cheese croissant?
faqs.a: Roughly 600 mg, due to the ham, cheese, and any added salt in the dough.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower calorie ham cheese croissant?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for low-fat cheese, lean ham, or bake with less butter to reduce calories by 50+.
